page.title: 01A RURAL VILLAGE
page.content: Dalmally is a small rural village in Argyll & Bute Division of Strathclyde Region. The village is situated 60miles from Glasgow, our nearest large town is Oban which is 25miles away. When travelling from Glasgow your first sight of Dalmally is from the top of Strone Hill. From this vantage point Dalmally looks like a small village surrounded by trees. As you get nearer you can see that the area has much land used by the Forestry Commision. From this initial view the other main land cover is obviously rough grazing for sheep. There are about 300 people living in Dalmally. The village appears to be in two parts, a new part consisting of houses, a school and a shop. The older part of the village has fewer house with a Post Office,Garage,a small gift shop and a Railway Station.
